channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Australia hikes its interest rate for the first time in more than a decade
item.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia said the cash rate will be increased by 25 basis points to 0.35% — the first rate hike since November 2010.

item.title: Fears of a Fed mistake grow as this week's anticipated interest rate hike looms
item.description: The Federal Reserve is tasked with slowing the U.S. economy enough to control inflation but not so much that it tips into recession.

item.title: Alibaba's shares fall in Hong Kong following unconfirmed rumors linking Jack Ma to probe
item.description: Alibaba's Hong Kong-listed shares fell Tuesday after unconfirmed rumors linked the internet tech giant's founder Jack Ma to a national security investigation.

item.title: India's green hydrogen rush lures companies but hurdles remain
item.description: Indian companies are committing billions of dollars to green hydrogen projects but experts caution technology is still very new.

item.title: Stock futures rise after big market reversal to start May
item.description: Investors are coming off a wild up-and-down session for stocks, with the S&P 500 rising on Monday after hitting a new 2022 low.

item.title: 'Bubble' hitting 50% of market, top investor warns as Fed gets ready to meet
item.description: Despite Monday's market comeback, Dan Suzuki, Richard Bernstein Advisors' deputy CIO, delivers growth stocks are in the early innings of a dramatic decline.

item.title: Op-ed: It's time for the World Bank to get back to the business of doing business
item.description: A misguided killing of the long-running "Ease of Doing Business" report underscores a need for reform at the World Bank.

item.title: Jim Cramer says to buy the dip on days like Monday: 'It’ll be too late' if you wait for the Fed
item.description: "I know from experience that if you wait until the [Federal Reserve] is done and inflation's broken, it'll be too late to buy," the "Mad Money" host said.

item.title: Why solo female travelers are joining group tours
item.description: Solo travel is typically associated with flexibility, and group tours are seen as rigid. So why are female solo travelers signing up for this style of travel?

item.title: When inflation is high, Warren Buffett says the best thing you can do is 'be exceptionally good at something'
item.description: There is little that individuals can do to avoid inflation at the cash register, but Buffett says that it is possible to protect against its effects.

item.title: 10-year Treasury yield tops 3% for first time since 2018
item.description: U.S. Treasury yields continued their push higher on Monday, as investors monitored economic data and monetary policy on the first trading day of May.

item.title: How this U.S.-made, $176,000 anti-tank weapon could change the war in Ukraine
item.description: The U.S. has sent thousands of Javelin weapon systems to Ukraine — what does this mean for supplies of this vaunted weapon?

item.title: Stocks rebound after S&P 500 hits lowest level of 2022, Nasdaq rises 1.6%
item.description: U.S. stocks were volatile again on Monday but closed higher.

item.title: Time for a fourth Covid vaccine dose? Here's why medical professionals are skeptical
item.description: Medical professionals are undecided on whether a fourth dose of the Covid-19 vaccine would benefit the wider population.

item.title: India's record-setting heat wave in pictures
item.description: India has been dealing with an unusually early heat wave for months. April was the third hottest April on record and March was the hottest.

item.title: Atlassian co-CEO invests in Australian energy company to force it to go greener
item.description: Mike Cannon-Brookes is on a tear with climate investments. Now he has succeeded in taking part ownership of one of Australia's top energy companies.

item.title: The Federal Reserve's fight with inflation could cool the hot labor market, risking stagflation
item.description: Prices are rising as the Fed winds down a historic round of stimulus. This tightening cycle could slow jobs growth as global markets ride a wave of volatility.

item.title: Chip supply issues are still giving some of world's biggest companies a major headache
item.description: An ongoing shortage of chips and other basic materials is forcing tech and automotive giants to scale back their targets.

item.title: It’s not just Russia – China’s also contributing to higher inflation worldwide, report says
item.description: Russia is guilty of creating a food security crisis and higher energy prices, but China is also worsening inflation in three areas, said a think tank.

item.title: Prime Minister Boris Johnson says the UK will build one new nuclear plant a year
item.description: The U.K. is doubling down on nuclear power as Europe tries to move away from dependency on Russian oil and gas.

item.title: Finland has walked a political tightrope between Moscow and the West for decades. But that could be about to end
item.description: Finland could be about to announce that it's joining the military alliance NATO — in what would mark a dramatic U-turn for its foreign policy.

item.title: Amazon workers at second Staten Island warehouse reject union
item.description: The decision comes just a month after a neighboring Amazon warehouse, known as JFK8, voted in favor of the company's first U.S. union.

item.title: Here’s how you can prepare if there's a half point rate hike from the Fed
item.description: As the Fed tries to pump the brakes on inflation, it will get more expensive to borrow. Here's how to prepare.

item.title: EU regulator accuses Apple of restricting rivals' access to payment tech
item.description: The move could potentially result in a fine for Apple and requirements it change how the the payments system works.

item.title: Home affordability is nearly the worst on record as mortgage rates spike
item.description: Overheated home prices and sharply higher mortgage rates are crushing housing affordability.

item.title: Bill Gates on Covid: ‘I don’t want to be a voice of doom and gloom,’ but 'the worst’ could still be ahead
item.description: Bill Gates says the World Health Organization needs to launch a global surveillance team to quickly identify disease outbreaks before they become the next pandemic.

item.title: Netflix cancels Meghan Markle series 'Pearl' amid cutbacks
item.description: It marks the latest cost-saving moves after the company reported a disappointing first quarter.

item.title: Chrysler parent Stellantis plans $2.8 billion overhaul of two Canadian factories to build EVs
item.description: Two Canadian factories that build Chrysler's minivans and Dodge's muscle cars will be retooled for EVs

item.title: Successful people do these 3 things on Sunday for a happier, stress-free week, according to a productivity expert
item.description: There’s no magic cure for the ‘Sunday Scaries,’ but these three strategies, recommended by productivity expert Chris Bailey, can help.

item.title: Biden kicks off $3 billion plan to boost battery production for electric vehicles
item.description: The White House plan to accelerate battery production is part of a broader effort to shift the country away from gas-powered cars to electric vehicles.
